channel.title: Language Evolution :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: One of the strategies that computer scientists employed to counter the software crisis was the development of new programming languages. These new languages would often 1) adopt new techniques intended to make errors harder to make while programming, and 2) remove problematic features that had existed in earlier languages. A Fortran Example Letâ€™s take a look at a working (and in current use) program built using Fortran, one of the most popular programming languages at the onset of the software crisis.
